thread.title: Woodward Academy senior selected to hit first shot at PGA Tour Championship
thread.title_full: Woodward Academy senior selected to hit first shot at PGA Tour Championship

author: Staff Reports (noreply@neighbornewspapers.com)
title: Woodward Academy senior selected to hit first shot at PGA Tour Championship
text: slideshow Woodward senior Jakari Harris was chosen to hit the first shot at the PGA Tour Championship at East Lake Golf Course in Atlanta on Sept. 24. Harris participated in the PGA Tour Championship as a member of The First Tee, an international organization seeking positive youth development through the game of golf.Harris was selected for the PGA honor due to her contributions to the community on and off the course. She is a current member of the Honor Roll at Woodward Academy and a participant in the National Society of High School Scholars. Harris was one of eight athletes selected for the Georgia High School Golf Coaches Association Class AAA All-State Golf Team, receiving the All-State Girls Golf Award.The First Tee works to shape the lives of youth in 50 US states by reinforcing values of respect, perseverance, honesty and integrity through golf. The program seeks to foster in youth a desire to excel in school, set and achieve goals and pursue community service. Share This Article | similar stories
